description:
traditionally, unix commands support a '-' to indicate that content should be written to stdout rather than a file.
It would be nice if 'nova-manage environment' would do this.

ie:
$ sudo nova-manage project environment test-project admin - | grep NOVA_URL
  import pkg_resources
export NOVA_URL="http://10.202.9.127:8774/v1.0/"

ProblemType: Bug
DistroRelease: Ubuntu 11.10
Package: nova-common 2011.3~d3~20110708.1251-0ubuntu1 [modified: usr/bin/nova-manage]
ProcVersionSignature: User Name 3.0-3.4-virtual 3.0.0-rc5
Uname: Linux 3.0-3-virtual x86_64
Architecture: amd64
Date: Wed Jul 13 21:07:07 2011
PackageArchitecture: all
ProcEnviron:
 PATH=(custom, user)
 LANG=en_US.UTF-8
 SHELL=/bin/bash
SourcePackage: nova
UpgradeStatus: No upgrade log present (probably fresh install)
title: support '-' for writing to stdout in nova-manage environment/zip
